thread.title: Ex-Hoboken preschool teacher charged with child abuse
thread.title_full: Ex-Hoboken preschool teacher charged with child abuse - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Ex-Hoboken preschool teacher charged with child abuse
text:
NBC 4 New York Five teachers were fired from the Apple Montessori School in Hoboken in June amid reports of abuse. A Hoboken preschool teacher was indicted on child endangerment charges Friday after video surfaced showing her swinging a toddler in the air by her arms.
Kelli Dugan, 31, was charged with endangering the welfare of a child and child abuse after cellphone video was posted to Facebook showing one toddler being slammed to the ground and another being flung in the air while her arms were held down by Dugan, The News reported in June.
Dugan and the teacher seen slamming the toddler to the ground were two of the five teachers at the Apple Montessori School who were fired in June.
The video was taken by someone in a nearby building who shared it on Facebook after fearing the school would bury the issue, NBC reported.
Dugan's attorney Anthony Carbone told NBC New York that he was confident the charges would be dismissed.
